elements.title: Nancy Nash (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nancy Nash (pictured) had to convince her parents to let her not attend the University of Texas to instead become an actress in 1926?

elements.title: a letter to the American people (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a letter to the American people allegedly written by Osama bin Laden has been cited as an example of online youth radicalization?

elements.title: Hare Hare Yukai (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "Hare Hare Yukai" is credited with originating the genre of cover dance videos, in which individuals attempt to replicate dance choreography on video-sharing websites?

elements.title: Allerton 39th Street House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that F. Scott Fitzgerald wrote the short stories "The Jelly-Bean" and "May Day" at the Allerton 39th Street House?

elements.title: a radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lachlan Murdoch was forced to resign as a director of Prime Media Group because the company owned a radio station on Queensland's Sunshine Coast?

elements.title: Guillermo Torrez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that small-business leaders such as Guillermo Torrez sympathized with the Movement for Socialism despite its anti-capitalist rhetoric?

elements.title: ballads about homeschooled girls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olivia Rodrigo can write ballads about homeschooled girls as well as about songbirds and snakes?

elements.title: Queen Morphia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when her husband was captured by the Turks, Queen Morphia hired a band of secretly armed fake monks and merchants to infiltrate the prison and rescue him – only for him to be captured again?
